main event: A newspaper photographer in Leibnitz, Austria spotted a silver disc-shaped object hovering over a wooded area that accelerated to high speed and disappeared in 1950.
interesting points: The object hovered for about 10 seconds at an altitude of around 45 feet.
The object had a metallic, glowing appearance and was estimated to be 6-8 meters in diameter.
The object moved at a tremendous speed from east to west before disappearing.
The photographer took two photographs of the object, but they only showed a streak of light due to the object's high speed.
The sighting caused a patch of grass where the object hovered to turn brown and wilt, suggesting some kind of heat or radiation emitted from the object.
photographs: yes, but they only showed a streak of light
